thread.title: State Highway 1 closed as investigation continues into fatal crash near Blenheim
thread.title_full: State Highway 1 closed as investigation continues into fatal crash near Blenheim

author: JEFFREY KITT
title: State Highway 1 closed as investigation continues into fatal crash near Blenheim
text:
State Highway 1 closed as investigation continues into fatal crash near Blenheim JEFFREY KITT Last updated 12:20, February 20 2017 SCOTT HAMMOND/FAIRFAX NZ 
The serious crash unit investigates the cause of a fatal accident north of Blenheim. 
A major highway is closed as a fatal car crash is investigated near Blenheim. 
A teenager died after a seven-seater SUV rolled on State Highway 1, close to the Spring Creek intersection about 8 kilometres north of Blenheim, about 4.30pm on Sunday. 
The highway was closed in both directions on Monday morning as specialist investigators attended the scene. FAIRFAX NZ 
A SUV carrying eight teenagers rolled on State Highway 1 near Spring Creek on Sunday. 
Sergeant Graham Single, of Blenheim, said eight people, four male and four female teenagers, were in the car when it crashed and rolled onto its side. 
READ MORE: Teenager dead after serious crash on SH1 in Blenheim 
No other vehicles were involved in the crash. 
Blenheim high schools had been advised to offer trauma counselling to help students cope with the accident, Single said. 
"It's important for people to talk to each other, to peers and parents, and make sure they don't bottle it inside," he said. 
"You never like to see anyone die, but it is hard to see kids involved. 
"Police officers have kids too and it hits home." Ad Feedback 
A detour was in place using Murray's Rd before returning to SH1. 
The ages of the teenagers ranged from 15 to 17, but Single would not comment on the age or gender of the deceased. 
Single said he did not know whether alcohol was involved in the crash. 
Senior Sergeant Julian Lewis said next-of-kin were still being notified and expected the name of the deceased to be released on Tuesday. 
Three fire trucks from the Blenheim Volunteer Fire Brigade attended the scene on Sunday, along with the Nelson Marlborough Rescue Helicopter and St John Ambulance. - The Marlborough Express
